definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The intuition of occupational most attracts you.
sentences.chinese: 而直覺性的職業也最吸引你。

sentences.english: We saw that intuitive methods are frequently wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經看到直覺性的方法經常是錯的。

sentences.english: Your spirit more than others of the penetrating power of intuition.
sentences.chinese: 你的精神比其他人更具有直覺性的穿透力。

sentences.english: Today we live in a world that does not accommodate these instinctual needs very well.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們生活的世界不大需要適應這種直覺性的需求。
